title: Typewriter type font
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317131805im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Type_4162.png)

Font: 

 HY Gung So (Bold) 

Solved By: 

 [fvilanakis](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317131805/http:/typophile.com/user/176276 "View user profile.")

author: MThawkwood

comments.content:
Your mage at 40% and rearranged to make it easier to read in Typophile's small window:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317131805im_/http:/typophile.com/files/TypewriterStylehtypophile117218SM_5409.jpg)
  
This monotone font have been derived from a typewriter but it's not monospaced like a typewriter typeface. looks familiar. Now lets check.  
Don

Very close to Courier (e.g. from Linotype) but it better matches to **[HY GungSo (Bold)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317131805/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Adobe&ffam=HY%20GungSo%20Std%20-%20B%20Bold&fid=9e1e0ba3e1e98ad6bf035e23df164636&fsize=36&text=New%20R%20s%20Packaging%2C%20Inc%20BMC%20layout%20IMPRESSION&wrap=2)** available from Adobe.

I think the same glyphs are used in the Roman set of **Gungsuh** a Microsoft font supporting many codes pages and designed by HanYang I&C Co.,LTD. [2000]:  
 [http://www.microsoft.com/typography/fonts/font.aspx?FMID=1512](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317131805/http:/www.microsoft.com/typography/fonts/font.aspx?FMID=1512 "http://www.microsoft.com/typography/fonts/font.aspx?FMID=1512")

You could use Serifa [http://www.myfonts.com/search/serifa/fonts/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317131805/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/serifa/fonts/ "http://www.myfonts.com/search/serifa/fonts/") as a fairly similar substitute if you don't have a copy of HYGungSoStd or Gungsuh at hand. If you have a recent version of Windows you have Gungsuh installed.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317131805im_/http:/typophile.com/files/GungsuhInUseTypophile117218_3748.jpg)
  
Don

I checked the Latin glyph outlines in HY GungSo (Bold) and Gungsuh. I confirm that they do indeed match.  
Don
